bug.author: luiscruz
bug.summary: Disabling one checkbox disables the following checkboxes but not their output
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
When disabling checkboxes, succeeding checkboxes present a weird behaviour: They are disabled but their output acts as if they were enabled. This is not the same but it is related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/386>#386</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
The issue can be reproduced using this checkbox-snip: <denchmark-code>if st.checkbox("Checkbox1"): st.markdown("This is a cool feature that does this....") if st.checkbox("Checkbox2"): st.markdown("This is a cool feature that does this....") </denchmark-code>
The output looks like this: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1080714/66759614-de1aff00-eea0-11e9-9e76-0b69ccaae1e6.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Enable Checkbox1
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1080714/66759635-e5daa380-eea0-11e9-8951-705a42a356a3.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Enable Checkbox2
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1080714/66759655-effca200-eea0-11e9-9a6a-6d990b8f0ab9.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Disable Checkbox1
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1080714/66759681-00148180-eea1-11e9-862f-33d49bf3c82e.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
After step 3 I would expect the checkbox2 to be A) completely disabled or B) left enabled: A) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1080714/66759898-600b2800-eea1-11e9-918f-b3faa99d0f69.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
B) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1080714/66759886-5b467400-eea1-11e9-960c-e38030a3355f.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Explained above. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
dunno <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.47.4 Python version: 3.7.4 OS version: 10.14.6 Browser version: 12.1.2
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
na

comments.comment: I would like to give it a try and create a PR for this but I would need some initial advice.

I tried to look into this with reverse engineering. I understand now the DeltaGenerator model, and I think I got how the Checkbox.tsx works. Still, I don't understand where the change in a widget is triggering the update of other widgets in the UI. Perhaps, some clarification on this would help me understand how to fix the issue. Cheers
I also encountered the same issue. Can anyone from Streamlit Team look and resolve this bug?
